Content:: Pavlopil (Ukrainian: Павлопіль; Russian: Павлополь) is a village in Volnovakha Raion (district) in Donetsk Oblast of eastern Ukraine, at about 25 km NW from Novoazovsk and about 25 km NE from Mariupol, on the left bank of the Kalmius river. The conflict between Ukraine and pro-Russian forces, that started in April 2014, has brought along both civilian and military casualties.[1] In May 2016, a male civilian was killed and another injured when a tractor they were driving on hit an unidentified explosive device.[2] Kalmius Native language as of the Ukrainian Census of 2001:[3] Media related to Pavlopil at Wikimedia Commons This article about a location in Donetsk Oblast is a stub.
